Murray Anderson's Almanac. I can't remember the words -- Show girl. Liza -- Fifty million Frenchmen. You don't know Paree -- Sweet Adeline. My husband's first wife -- Spring is here. Why can't I -- Little show. I guess I'll have to change my plan -- Fifty million Frenchmen. Find me a primitive man -- Sons o' guns. It's you I love -- Little show. Moanin' low -- Great day. Without a song -- Bitter sweet. If love were all -- Murray Anderson's almanac. I may be wrong but I think you're wonderful -- Little show. Can't we be friends -- Heads up. Ship without a sail -- Great day. More than you know -- Follow throu. I want to be bad -- Wake up and dream. I'm a gigolo -- Wake up and dream. What is this thing called love -- Fifty million Frenchmen. You got that thing -- Spring is here. With a song in my heart -- Follow thru. Button up your overcoat.

Silk stockings. Stereophonic sound -- Ankles aweigh. Nothing can replace a man -- Pipe dream. All at once you l ove her -- Ankles aweigh. Kiss me and kill me with love -- Vamp. I've always loved you -- Damn Yankees. Little brains, a little talent -- Ankles aweigh. Honeymoon -- Plain and fancy. Young and foolish -- Ankles aweigh. Headin' for the bottom blues -- Damn yankees. Those were the good old days -- Vamp. Four little misfits -- Damn Yankees. Whatever Lola wants -- Plain and fancy. It's a helluva way to run a love affair -- Vamp. Why does it have to be you -- Silk stockings. Paris loves lovers -- Silk stockings. All of you -- Pipe dream. Everybody's got a home but me -- Plain and fancy. This is all very new to me -- Damn Yankees. Heart.

At head of title on container:

The Ross Patterson Little Big Band (Don Falzone, bass ; Gene Lewin, drums ; James Tsao, violin ; Chuck Wilson, woodwinds ; Ross Patterson, piano), produced and hosted by Scott Siegel, with various vocalists.
Created and written by Scott Siegel; Ross Patterson, musical director, arranger.
"A handful of show-stopping numbers cut in order to get this CD producted at less than eighty minutes."
Program notes by Scott Siegel inserted in container.

West Side story. Something's coming -- Anyone can whistle. Everybody says don't -- Kiss me Kate. Were thine that special face -- Guys and dolls. Sit down you're rockin' the boat -- Baby. Patterns cut -- Steel pier. Winning cut -- West Side story. Somewhere -- South Pacific. This nearly was mine -- West Side story. Tonight -- Jesus Christ superstar. Heaven on their minds -- The gay life. Magic moment -- Big river. Free at last -- Happy end. Surabaya Johnny -- Fine and dandy. Nobody breaks my heart -- Camelot. If ever I would leave you -- Side show. Who will love me as I am -- Great day. More than you know -- The glorious ones. I was here -- Spring is here. With a song in my heart.
At head of title on container:
Songs from musicals; original Off-Broadway cast recording.

Various vocalists (Bill Daugherty, David Brian Colbert, Jeffrey Denman, John Easterlin, Kelsey Fowler, Lisa Howard, Marc Kudisch, Sarah Jane McMahon, Janet Metz, William Michals, Manu Narayan, Jill Paice, Daniel Reichard, Emily Skinner, Terri White) ; the Ross Patterson Little Big Band (Ross Patterson, piano ; Joe Dennison, violin ; Randy Landau, bass), hosted by Scott Siegel.
Produced by Scott Siegel. Ross Patterson, musical director. Produced for CD by Peter Pinne.
Live recording of the off-Broadway show, sung with no mikes except for recording purposes.
Program notes by Rob Lester inserted in container.

Arr. by Bruce Kimmel and Todd Ellison, orchestrated by David Siegel (1st-2nd, 7th, 10th, and 15th-17th works).
Emily Skinner, Alice Ripley, vocals ; Ross Patterson, Tom Kitt (6th work), piano ; Randy Landau, bass ; Shannon Ford, drums ; Jack Bashkow, reeds.
Album produced by Bruce Kimmel; Danny Lawrence, engineer; Mike Russi, assistant engineer; mixed by Vincent Cirilli; mastered by James Nelson, Digital Outland.

Two's company : from The magic show / Stephen Schwartz -- Little me : from Little me / Coleman, Leigh -- I'd rather wake up by myself : from By the beautiful sea / Schwartz, Fields -- Cigarette dream/The last smoker in America : from Little fish/The last smoker in America / Michael John LaChiusa, Bill Russell, Peter Melnick -- Sleepy man / Waldman, Uhry -- I miss the mountains : from Feeling electric / Tom Kitt, Brian Yorkey -- Every day a little death : from A little night music / Stephen Sondheim -- No one is alone : from Into the woods / Stephen Sondheim -- Broadway baby : from Follies / Stephen Sondheim -- Sisters/Ohio : from White Christmas/Wonderful town / Irving Berlin, Bernstein, Comden and Green -- Trouble / Leiber and Stoller -- Poor unfortunate souls : from The little mermaid / Menken/Ashman -- You have to be there : from Kristina / Andersson and Ulvaeus, Kretzmer -- Come up and see me some time / A. Swanstrom, L. Alter -- Past my prime : from Li'l Abner / Mercer, de Paul -- Lazy afternoon : from The golden apple / Moross, Latouche -- She's gone ; Who will love me as I am? ; I will never leave you : from Side show / Russell, Krieger.

[music by Gary Schocker ; book and lyrics by Barbara Campbell].

Excerpts from three musicals; songs from the 1st are based on the novel by Thomas Hardy; the 2nd work, a musical retelling of the love affair of Thomas Jefferson and Sally Hemings; the 3rd work is based on the novella by Kate Chopin.

Ann Hampton Callaway, Liz Callaway, Victoria Clark, Brian d'Arcy James, Doug LaBrecque, LaChanze, Peter Lockyer, David Masenheimer, Judy McLane, Christiane Noll, Emily Skinner, vocalists ; musicians ; Bradley Vieth, conductor.
Sean Swinney Recordings, New York, N.Y.
Program notes, biographical notes on the creators and performers, and synopses by Barbara Campbell inserted in container.
